cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 470 miles ESE of Key West, Florida and 165 miles E of Camagüey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest just north of Cuba, then turning northwest toward the Florida Keys Saturday and the eastern Gulf Coast / Florida Panhandle late Sunday–Monday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle near the Alabama–Florida border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch: Florida Keys (Ocean Reef to Dry Tortugas) and southwest Florida coast (Bonita Beach to Ocean Reef), several Cuban provinces
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect; no hurricane or tropical-storm warnings issued with Advisory #13
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Cuba, Florida Keys, South & Central Florida Peninsula, Florida Panhandle, Alabama and portions of the southeast U.S. coast
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (Boston, MA not listed in wind-probability table)
weather_observation.wind: None expected within 5-day window; only distant, weakened remnants may bring breezy conditions after day-5 period
weather_observation.rainfall: Possible light to moderate rain early next week if Fred’s remnants curve northeast, but heavy rainfall not anticipated
